The most valuable pharmacological properties of passionflower are soothing and sedative. It was they who determined the increased interest in the plant of official medicine. It is used to produce drugs and nutritional supplements indicated for neurasthenic disorders, diseases of the nervous system, depression, sleep disorders, and epilepsy. The most biologically active component of the plant is considered passiflorin - a substance that acts like morphine. A number of sleeping pills and sedatives contain passionflower as an active ingredient: Palora, Novo-Passit, Sedistress, Alora.
